Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all round place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: CrystalTips693
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were spending a long weekend in Rome for a friend's 50th and the rugby. We found this hotel to be excellent in all respects - The hotel felt quite traditional - simple, without any frills, but clean and with everything you would expect from a hotel. The staff were immensely friendly and the continental breakfasts were definitely more than sufficient. The location is as central as one could ever wish for, and there isn't a great need to use the transport system in order to see the sights. If we're lucky enough to visit Rome again, we would happily stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Pilier3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Teatro for a long weeknd, Thurs - Mon. The staff are all tremendously welcoming and helpful. The night concierge couldn't have been more friendly when we arrived. The rooms are large and beds comfortable. It was the coldest time in Rome and our room was warm. Partsare a little tired, this lent to the charm of the place but it is clear the room was maintained regularly. My biggest complaint was the shower head could have been replaced or descaled but the shower serviceable. Breakfast in the vaulted basement was brilliant, I doubt you;d find a place with to have breakfast with more history. Great Italian coffee, big pots of real Italian coffee made on an Espresso machine, heaven. As to location you're surrounded by really good Italian restaurants. You're next to the Campo di Fiori, the flower and fruit market there plus all it's bars, restaurants and the boutique shops. The Campo Di Fiori is like a small village in the centre of Rome. It's only a block or two away from the Vatican, the Castello and the Trastevere I can recommend the Hotel Teatro di Pompeo for a comfortable stay in Rome in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Small and quiet hotel in the Centre”
Reviews.Author: deborah_klump
Reviews.Content: WE stayed in this hotel for our honeymoontrip tot Rome. The location is really downtown and very accessible by public transport, taxis or (preferably!) by foot. But be aware: all these lovely narrow streets are NOT easy to walk on on your high heels! So bring your stylish but comfy shoes.... I was surprised that despite the professional attitude the welcome for a just-married couple was totally plain: not even a tiny chocolate or a small complimentary card on the bed or desk. Apparently this hotel receives its guests continuously without making any effort or it would at least make a small gesture as appreciation for choosing this hotel on a honeymoon I would say. The staff is friendly. Except for the lady that served us breakfast: my husband was kind of afraid to ask her for another espresso because of her non-verbal communication! Breakfast is ok: lots to choose from, but very standard quality. A narrow elevator brings you to your floor (we were on 3rd, streetside).The room is quiet and a bit dark with dark furniture. The bed is a bit hard, but I slept really well. The bathroom is small, but kept very clean. We didn't watch any TV because there was no interesting international channel. There's a very good artisanal bakery up the street. I forgot its name, but I was sorry that I wasn't in time to buy a package of the aniseed and cinnamon cookies to bring home.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Dellanno31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our initial trip to Itlay in 05 and were concerned that this little gem could not replicate our fantastic experience....our concerns were without merit! If anything, our 6 day stay was more enjoyable as we were able to interact with the staff a bit more. Paolo and Simone were very helpful and kind. The rooms are clean and the service is first rate. The breakfast, especially the coffee, is to die for! Thank to Paolo and Simone. You deserve raises for taking care of us over Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel with a excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 0210Kristian
Reviews.Content: With only 12 rooms you are beeing taken care off in a personally way from the staff. And with only 2 minutes from Piazza de Fiori, you can start the tourist walk right ouside the door. Since there are some noise between the floors (steps, not voices), ask for the 3 rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ddidy27
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop in Italy and we were not disappointed. This former theatre was quite charming. The price was reasonable, our room was clean and it was right around the corner from the Campo di Fiori (a wonderful piazza with many restaurants and a weekly marketplace). Paulo, one of the front desk people, was very kind and tremendously helpful. It was not the swankiest place, but we were certainly not in Rome to spend time in our room. Be sure to note where the hotel is situated, as this location can be tricky to find on your way back from dinner. Paulo gave us business cards to carry just in case we were lost; we used them on a few occasions :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: flowerofscotland10
Reviews.Content: Steeped in history and built on the remains of the ancient Roman Pompey's Theatre dating back to the year 55 BC, this small boutique hotel is tucked away in the heart of Rome's historical centre, just a few minutes walk away from, e.g. the Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, or the Campo de’ Fiori – with its square surrounded by many good and quite reasonably priced restaurants, and with a wonderful fruit and vegetable market during weekdays – and many other Rome attractions and monuments are within walking distance. The air-conditioned rooms are comfortable albeit rather old fashioned. We stayed in the main part of the hotel rather than the annex; the room was fairly spacious and noise levels penetrating from outside were bearable. A good breakfast is served downstairs in a rather dark, cave-like room (well, it forms part of the ancient Roman ruins after all!), and which also offers two PCs for free Internet access. Staff at the reception desk were exceptionally friendly and helpful at all times. All in all we enjoyed our three nights stay and would consider staying here again. Two small points though: (i) a mini-bar is provided, but cheap plastic cups instead of glasses in a three star hotel are a turnoff; (ii) the bottom part of the shower cubicle in our room was rather grubby and in dire need of some regrouting.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Small Hotel in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: CalNU
Reviews.Content: Delightful. Great location, huge rooms, delicious and enchanting breakfast. The staff was wonderful all around. Totally gay-friendly as well; my partner and I felt welcome the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dermott25
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay in the Teatro Di Pompeo. When you arrive the reception is small (but clean and efficient) and so you don't know what to expect. However, the rooms are fantastic, spacious, clean and quiet. My room looked out onto a small courtyard and had air conditioning (but I didn't need it because of the windows). Breakfast is lovely and situated downstairs. There is also a good bar for drinks which was great. The location of the hotel is perfect and the best parts of Rome are in walking distance. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location!”
Reviews.Author: marialaura215
Reviews.Content: THe hotel was a great choice, location and the hotel itself good! My room had a beautiul view of the street... bathroom clean, AC... the people at the hotel were super friendly, cool breakfast room (part of the roman ruin!)

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Norb G
Reviews.Content: This hotel has few frills but is clean, super convenient with its downtown location, and the staff is great. The included breakfast is excellent and well stocked (fresh local hams, cheeses, eggs, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!Reccomended”
Reviews.Author: Chariton
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for four nights and everything was perfect.From the quality of the sleep until the location.We didn't take any bus or taxi to the sightseeing.You can go everywhere by foot.Of course the breakfast is little poor but this doesn't matter at all.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment-style stay with hotel amenities”
Reviews.Author: Addison833
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 11 nights in July 2011, so quite a long stay. We stayed in room 2 in the 'annex' which is the largest of the two rooms in the apartment-style lodgings that are located just seconds away from the main hotel. We really loved this arrangement because we felt we had extreme privacy, yet we enjoyed the services of being in a hotel (breakfasts, tourist advice, wake up calls, room cleaning, etc.). Here are the pros: - Fabulous Location: Just a two minute walk away to the the heart of Campo di Fiori but on a quiet street. We didn't have any issues with noise and enjoyed being able to stroll to Campo di Fiori, Piazza Navona, the Jewish Ghetto and Trastevere. - Complementary Breakfast: from 7am-10am daily, there is a breakfast that is absolutely sufficient to get you on your way - salami, cheeses, yoghurt, breads, hard boiled eggs, cereals, cakes, fruit, etc. There is a barista who will also make and bring you cappuccinos, espressos, teas. I gotta say - the Ponte Sisto has a better breakfast (food and setting) but it's also a pricier hotel. - Friendly and Helpful Staff - Everyone we encountered was very friendly and open to help with advice and assistance. We had an issue with our airport shuttle and Americo (sp?) was incredibly patient and helpful in sorting out the issue by calling the company repeatedly and resolving the issue. - Spacious and lovely room - the room where we stayed (number 2 in the annex) was very large and bright with huge windows and lots of storage space. Bathroom was also absolutely fine. The bed was the size of a king-size bed. It was two single beds together but it never felt like that. I had thought that perhaps we would fall through the crack (!) but that never happened and it never felt like two beds. - Air Conditioning - was amazing - so cool with remote control. Worked perfectly. Cons: - If you have mobility issues, you should be specific and request that you stay in the main hotel. I counted 50 stairs up to our room which could be a bit of a drag after coming home from a day of sightseeing, but it was absolutely bearable (and I was 4 and a half months pregnant). - the mattress (in our room) at least was incredibly hard. My boyfriend loved it, but I actually ended up folding two blankets in half and putting them under the bottom sheet to give it a bit more cushion. I heard from another guest in the main hotel that her mattress was also hard so this may be hotel-wide, but not sure. - TV didn't work - we mentioned this to the hotel the day we checked in and they said someone would look at it the next day. No one ever did, but we weren't interested enough in TV to raise it again. I'm sure if we reminded them, someone would have come by. Those 'negatives' are honestly hardly worth mentioning - they wouldn't prevent us from staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: anne60795
Reviews.Content: My room was SPOTLESS...not sure where the previous reviewer stayed :) Very convenient to Piazza Navona and I could walk to other places like the Spanish Steps and St. Peter's. Breakfast was included: also steps away from Campo di Fiori a nice place for dinner if you're on your own and fun to stroll the market in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, dirty and worth less than 1 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sqt_SQT
Reviews.Content: Room dirty, people urined and odor smell. The air condition controlled by the front desk and must be requested. the hall way light was dark and you must manual turned on the light. The bed was very soft while the bathroom was dirty and contained odor towell. I was stay 2 night in June, 2011. It was 25 min walking from Termini under a construction walk. It was not closed to Termini at all and seemed not safe to work. The worst experience ever! DO NOT STAY AT THIS PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, perfect for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: EricfromParis02
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 2 nights here - it's located in one of the best locations in Rome, you can walk to everything and the staff is very pleasant (not always the case in Rome). Rooms are spotless and at mine was huge and quiet. AC in the rooms when you need it (which I didn't in March). It's right near the Campo de Fiori but not right on it so if you do stay over the weekend, you are far enough that you don't hear the mobs of teenagers partying at night. And the Campo de Fiori is a great place during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Great room, thin ceiling”
Reviews.Author: dancerjohn
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the staff was super friendly and very helpful. We were pleasantly surprised by the size and comfort of the room. The location was absolutely great, just a couple blocks from the Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. The included breakfast was nice and saved us some money. There were only two issues. First the double bed was actually two twins pushed together. Second, the floor and ceiling were really thin and we heard every step above us starting at 6am. All in all, would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cb222
Reviews.Content: Perfect loation in the historic center near Campo di Fiori. Walked to everything. Built on the ruins of the place where Ceasar was stabbed. Large room, quiet, good breakfast, elevator, bathtub. Free wireless internet in the lobby. A little hard to find after dark (and after a bottle of wine.) But it's a safe area and was fun to get lost. Construction at the place next door, but it was not a problem

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marinacarter
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a TERRIFIC location - next door to Campo de Fiori - but just around the corner so you didn't get the noise from the square. It is walking distance to all the big sights in Rome, and you can easily cross the river to the Trastevere neighborhood - which has some amazing restaurants. Our room was rather large, with a good size bathroom. Very comfy - (though my husband thought the bed was a little hard) and very clean. Free wifi was a nice bonus. I agree though that because of the construction going on right outside of the room - it was VERY loud during the weekday mornings. Otherwise, the staff were super friendly - and we would recommend this to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Too much noise. The neighbour building was under contruction.”
Reviews.Author: RicardoJF
Reviews.Content: The location is great. You can walk to many attraction. Many restaurants and bars in a short walk. The rooms are OK. Great breakfast. But the neighbor building was under construction so my walls seemed to be side by side with the construction. The noise of constructions was TERRIBLE! A good option when this damn construction is over. The receptionist at night was not very kind, but the other one in the morning was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: msjg
Reviews.Content: This hotel has plenty of old world charm and is in a central area great for exploring Rome. It is near Campo di Fiori but in a quiet location. The rooms are small but air conditioning and showers were good. Free Wi-Fi hot spot and computers with printers available in lobby for a charge. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & noisy (but you don't look for a hotel in the middle of Rome for sleep)”
Reviews.Author: Phreddiva
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel for your center-of-Rome lots-of-sightseeing stay. The pros - RIGHT IN THE MIDDLE of Rome. Every want to say "hey! I'm going to walk to the Pantheon before dinner"? Then this is your place. Breakfast is ample and delicious. Espresso bar service included (crucial if you, like me, cannot function without coffee). Helpful staff. The cons - Noise. My room was on the stairwell (maybe they all are?) and... WOW. Every noise. Also, construction was going on, which was loud and... I love the espresso, as I said, but the pounding of espresso maker is, I'm pretty sure, what woke me up both mornings (either that or the construction). Rooms - a little dingy, but who cares? You're not spending any time in them.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfactory 3-nite experience”
Reviews.Author: miatrav
Reviews.Content: very nice place. our two rooms on 2nd floor of main building were basic, smallish, but clean, and well maintained. great location. basic average breakfast offerings. wi-fi only works in lobby. hotel staff friendly. one guy a little chilly at first, told me i wouldn't like "real" roman food, but warmed up to me once we chatted a bit, insisted everyone in our family carry hotel's biz card in case someone got lost and needed to get to home base (which was nice of him).

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: ItalianShoes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of Rome, with everything in easy walking distance and a San Crispino less than a five minute walk. While the rooms are dated, the bathrooms are spotless, and I don't go to Rome to spend my time in the room. Usually, after a day wandering the magnificent sites of Rome, shopping and an belly full of amazing food and wine, I fall into a deep sleep. Breakfast is great and the ambience of the breakfast room is amazing. Paolo and Simona make the hotel feel like a home away from home. The main hotel is preferable to the annex, but I love the fact that the hotel is in the heart of Rome, where you watch locals go about their daily lives. Immersing yourself in local culture is what it is truly all about.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location in the heart of Rome's center with a fabulous staff.”
Reviews.Author: NSHSeattle
Reviews.Content: Our business group has stayed in the Teatro di Pompeo in March for the past 4 years. We have just booked our rooms for March 2010. We feel like a family being welcomed home on each arrival. All of the staff have made our stay very pleasant and the rooms have provided a perfect retreat during a busy meeting schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, value, great staff: a gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: Frenchie22
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at the Teatro di Pompeo and we cannot say enough good things about this hotel. To sum it up: the location is very central (Piazza Navona and Pantheon are 10 minutes away, the Colysseum is 20 minutes away and the lovely market on campo dei fiori is one minute away...), the staff are very friendly (helped us after we lost our camera in a cab, advising us on restaurants...), the room was big and comfortable. The breakfast room is unique in the ancient theater... I will go back to this hotel after other more less fortunate experiences in Rome. Did I mention the price was moderate (for a city like Rome anyway)?

Reviews.Title: “Total Dump & Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: marandalw
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in the beginning of October. I was not happy with this hotel and would never stay here again OR recommend to anyone. PROS: 1) Campo de Fiori is a very central location if you intend to walk to all the sights in Rome. It is possible to walk to all the sights BUT it is a lot of walking. Trevi Fountain Pantheon, & Piazza Navona is less than 10 min walk from hotel. Colosseum, Vatican City, Spanish Steps are 15 min walk from hotel. It is a 25Euro taxi ride from Termini train station to this hotel. 2) This hotel does have a reasonable price for Rome but you get what you pay for. 3) The breakfast area is unique. 4) Bathrooms are clean. CONS: 1) Campo de Fiori is a very dirty area in Rome. The area is full of graffiti, very loud, and trash pilled everywhere. I did not enjoy walking in this area. Also, Piazza Campo de Fiori is nothing special. 2) No FREE Wi-FI, its 5cents a min. 3) Night reception staff is unfriendly. I didn't want to ask questions because they were rude. 4) Rooms are small and walls are PAPER THIN. I didn't get any sleep in this hotel, you can hear EVERYTHING. The rooms face a parking lot, alley, and restaurant. Its VERY noisy. Also, you can hear everything from other rooms, even people talking. The beds are very hard and were difficult to sleep on. 5) The room was fairly clean but very old. The bedspread looked ancient and I didn't want to use it as a cover. Too dirty. I had to walk up 2-3 flights of narrow stairs carrying my luggage. I also had to walk past 2 large trash cans INSIDE to walk up the stairs. The smell was unbelievably FOUL. I had to hold my breath and run up the stairs. This was the most disgusting thing I've ever seen in a hotel. Overflowing trash indoors stinking up the entire hall and stairwell. I included a picture of this. I stayed in the Annex which is a separate building than the main hotel. Stairs may not be an issue in main hotel but noise level is the same. 6) We had a very early flight out of Rome and booked the car from the hotel to airport. It was a 30 min ride and we got there on time. Just be prepared that the driver does not speak very good English. We had to stop at a few terminals before we found the right airline. Just glad it was at the right airport. And the price for this trip is very pricey. I paid 65Euro for the trip to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RaeNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We love Rome and this was our fourth visit to this great city. We found this hotel to be in a good location for all the sights. Campo di Fiore is very close and an interesting place to wander around, day and evening. The room was spacious, clean, and quiet, and comfortable. The staff was always very pleasant and eager to help with any information we requested. They made dining suggestions and arranged for a driver to take us to the airport, etc. Breakfast was ready at 7:00 am which is early for Italy but well appreciated. All in all, it was a pleasant place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Rooms and Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: amstelina
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Teatro Di Pompeo is centrally located in Rome. You could walk everywhere. Piazza Navona was only a 5/10 minute walk and the cafes of Piazza Campo de'Fiori were steps away from the hotel. The rooms were very cozy and the staff was very friendly. Lastly, the breakfast included hard boiled eggs, which is hard to come by in Europe. My husband and I really enjoyed our stay here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Gem”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaTraveler_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three days at hotel following a European Cruise. Location, perfect, rooms clean and spacious, hotel staff, courteous, helpful, and will to do all to make a pleasant stay. We will absolutely return, this Hotel is Rome!

Reviews.Title: “real gem”
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of August with a family consisting of my husband and myself, 2 teens(15 and 17) and elderly parents. The rooms were clean, generously sized compared to many hotels we've stayed in in Europe, and the bathrooms very adequate (though I've never figured out the European fascination with the half shower door on the tub as the bathroom still gets wet). The location is quiet. Breakfast is perfect, even a freshly made cappuccino if you want. The internet is not free but quite reasonable fee. Paulo at the front desk was extraordinarily helpful (he was on duty most of the time we needed anything). As it was August, many of the restaurants he suggested were on vacation but as the hotel is a minute from Campo di Fiori and not much further from Piazza Navona, there was no trouble finding a place to eat. The location is perfect. We walked every where (didn't go to the Vatican this time but could have walked there also). We also had two tours, one of the sights of Rome and another out to the roman towns in the hills outside the city as it really was too hot to walk about too much during the day (though we still did on one day and all the evenings). We booked our tours through Paulo at www.drivingguide.com and the guide he arranged (Antonio) was excellent, even with my elderly parents. Take time in the morning (except Sunday) to see the market at Campo di fiori, not too big but interesting and not just for tourists. This is an excellent location to base yourself to see most of the historic centre sights. Take the hotel's offer to arrange the airport pickup, fairly reasonable priced and I wouldn't want to try to find this hotel by myself the first time. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sugrnspice1231
Reviews.Content: This review is a bit belated as we stayed at Teatro di Pompeo in March. This hotel is in an unbelievable location right near Campo dei'Fiori and not far from Piazza Navona-- all for a great, mid-range cost. In addition, the service we received was exceedingly friendly and helpful. The room was clean and charming. We are planning to stay here again on our next visit to Rome. Also, be sure to visit der Pallaro right next door for an unbelievable dinner. Don't let the fixed price or fixed menu scare you. Everything is delicious! We're planning to take a train from Florence on our next trip just to eat here again!

Reviews.Title: “Everything I needed from a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ShnookyBear
Reviews.Content: I stayed here very recently, from the 22nd June 09 to the 26th. It was my 3rd trip to Rome, so I knew the area quite well and picked this hotel mainly because of it's location but also because of the history it lies upon. It is a stones throw from the Campo dei Fiori (a great little market square) where we sampled Limoncello; the amazing Pantheon (my favourite site); the Jewish quarter/ghetto; and easy access to transportation (if needed - although the best way to see Rome is to walk!). Upon arrival, after waking at 4am to catch flights, and walking from the terminal station (mistake!) we were relieved to be greeted by a very friendly woman, who checked us in quickly and made us feel welcome, instantly. The room was delightfully chilled (thank you for air con!) and very clean, simple and rustic with the wooden beams in the ceiling. We hardly spent any time in the room because we were always on the go, ready to see more but it was a lovely resting spot, a base for our days outings. The room was cleaned every day after we had left, and was always spotless. Breakfast is a real treat, as you get to eat in the ruins of the Pompeii Theatre (there are pictures on the hotels website) and the selection of food is good for a continental breakfast - pastries, meats and cheeses, fruits, cereals, toast and fruit juices. Most hotels in Rome seem to offer no breakfast, so I appreciated this greatly as it was needed for the long days of walking and site seeing, ahead! The staff were all very friendly, and spoke good English. We were going to a Metallica concert in Rome but it was very far from the centre, and one of the staff was greatly helpful in directing us, and explaining the metro system. When you leave the hotel, you feel as though you've made some friends because it doesn't feel too "business-like" but you can have a friendly chat with the staff. The hotel had all the amenities I needed - WiFi access is 0.05 euro a minute, which is great for checking the odd e-mail and writing to family/friends. There was a mini bar (which I tend to just use as a fridge for store-bought items..but it's handy!) and even a laundry service if you need it. Downstairs, near the breakfast area, there are also many travel guides and there are maps at the front desk - very good maps, don't bother buying one! Overall, this hotel offered everything I needed. It was a lovely, quiet, clean place to stay and the personality and charm of the hotel added to the romantic, historical trip I was looking for. I liked the intimacy of the place - with only 13 rooms, the staff know everybody who is staying there, which gives a feel of security. I think it would be great for couples, familys, or just friends - it is suitable for all, really.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Service, Location”
Reviews.Author: greeneg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Teatro di Pompeo from May 30 to June 1, 2009 after a 14 night Best of Italy Cruise. The hotel is wonderfully located, particularly for the Campo di Fiore, Plaza Navoa, and the old Ghetto. The Pantheon is also an easy walk. There are numerous neighborhood restaurants available close by; despite the central location, we found the hotel to be a quiet oasis in the busy city. Clean, relatively large room ( #24), lots of hot water in a good shower, and a good breakfast in very interesting surroundings. Above all, outstanding service in a very helpful and welcoming manner. Not a cheap hotel, but one that gives very good value for money to my thinking.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable attractive and great location”
Reviews.Author: Marit_W
Reviews.Content: Very good service and very professionally run. They anticipate your needs and quickly comply. Very clean nice size room and bath. We had a tub! Good hearty breakfast. Close to the ruins. Located in a residential area which let us observe everyday life. Thankfully we had soundproof windows that we could close if it got too noisy. Pretty view from our window.

Reviews.Title: “A small Gem with great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: scscientist
Reviews.Content: Tiny hotel (10 rooms on site) but centrally located and with great staff assistance. Rooms smallish (by North Ameeican standards). but nicely furnished and comfortable. Staff arranged transport to from airport and was full of suggestions and assistance on where to go, etc. Even looked up restuarnats on internet for us. Lounge area uniquely furnished like grotto (it was an ancient theatre- thus the name) as was breakfast area. Superb & diverse breakfast. Internet available in lounge as was wireless. Our flight did not leave Rome until 1 am - and after checking out we were welcome to use the lounge. The desk clerk at the time also gave us home made cake (by his mother) while we were waiting. Overall a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: lauderdalebob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the nights of November 2 through 5, 2008, and everything couldn't have been better. The car service I arranged picked us up at the airport and whisked us right to the front door of the hotel, and a good thing too, since I'm not sure I would have found it at first by myself. Even after checking in (we arrived early so they held our luggage while we went wandering), I was certain we would find our way back. Guess again! Wandered round and round in a circle until we finally stumbled upon the place. After that adventure we made SURE we knew our way back. The hotel - wonderful, small place and everything couldn't have been nicer. VERY clean, comfortable, great free buffet breakfast, rather extensive by any means. You won't be disappointed with it. Internet connection? Cheap! 5 cents a minute. What a bargain. Two (or three, I forget) computers to use off of the check-in desk. Paolo (the manager), Simone, and all the other staff couldn't have been any nicer. If you are looking for a small, clean, comfortable hotel central to all the sights and transportation lines, look no further. You've found it . . . and at a reasonable price, at least reasonable by Rome standards. I can't remember our room number (there are only 13 I believe), but we were on the top floor facing the front of the hotel. I highly recommend the Teatro di Pompano.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Migs17
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful location for getting around Rome and seeing all it has to offer. The hotel itself is really nothing spectacular, but you can't beat the location for the price. The staff was very helpful and aided us in all our needs in getting around the city. The room was a little dark and dreary, but definitely clean, which is the most important thing to me. It was a little tricky trying to find the hotel because it is behind another hotel, but if you just ask for directions, you will be pointed in the right direction! Free breakfast was pretty good, internet usage was really cheap so that was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop in our Italian adventure!”
Reviews.Author: avivaleah
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop on our Italy trip. We were a little surprised that the room was dated compared to the other hotels we stayed in through out our trip. The TV was small and the satellite offered two English stations with BBC sound and picture not matching up. The room was clean and worked out fine once we got used to it. Paolo at the front desk was especially helpful and friendly. The internet offered was very reasonable priced and convenient. We loved the location of the hotel, so many of the major sites were within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a wonderful area of Rome”
Reviews.Author: jml66
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife on our honeymoon in September 2008. This part of Rome is my favorite area -- right in the middle of the oldest district. The hotel is itself almost next door to the Campo dei Fiori and is a quick walk to the Piazza Navona or Pantheon. The room is not lavishly decorated, but was nice. It was also quite large, with an extra smaller bed we did not even use. There was no road noise (we got a top floor room facing the courtyard) and the air conditioning was fine. The staff was hit and miss. Paolo and Simona were wonderful, especially Paolo, who is sweet, warm, energetic and helpful. However, a couple other front desk people were a lot stiffer and less helpful, almost making me feel like I was bothering them to ask them questions. The breakfast was sufficient, and is served in a cozy setting in the ancient understructure. The price is fairly high -- the highest of any hotel on our trip -- but I guess that is Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Hotel Teatro Di Pompeo”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFLY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night in a room in the annex. The location was excellent and the room was clean and charming. The breakfast was tasty and the staff was helpful. Our only complaint was that which we had with every hotel we stayed at in Italy, which was that the bed was not the most comfortable and rather than being one large bed it was two twin size beds pushed together.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: britstarlondon
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome at probably the worst time (August, hot & expensive) so the usual owners were away but the guy who was looking after it for them was a complete sweetie! He was very helpful and answered all questions & happily recommended local restaurants etc. The room was huge with fantastic air con and super clean. Plus we had an extra room with a single bed and bath towels which are a rarity (usually you only get small shower type towels). The view was of the top of the local church (nice to visit inside too) and we were at the back so it was really quiet! I recommend this hotel for anyone, really good choice!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience and an Absolutely Tremendous Value”
Reviews.Author: DaNonner
Reviews.Content: What a great place! Simona and Paolo were wonderful and went out of their way to make sure that our experience was a top-notch one. The rooms were clean and well appointed and the amenities were just fine. You cannot beat this location. There is no doubt we would return here if we ever went back to Rome. We heartily recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Teatro Di Pompeo”
Reviews.Author: Canady27
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is a little hard to find at first and not much to look at from the outside, the inside doesn't disappoint. The rooms are small, but clean. The bathrooms were comfortable and spotless. The location is perfect- just a walk from every attraction. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the breakfast exceeded our expectations, with plenty of options for every taste. Next door is a wonderful little restaurant, Trattoria der Pallaro. The food is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sam4282
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived to the Hotel Teatro Di Pompeo my mom was a little taken aback by its obscure location and lack of street appeal. However, she quickly grew to love this hotel in Rome. Hotel Teatro Di Pompeo is conveniently located by Campo del Fiori which is great for people watching. Although by a popular bar district the hotel itself was sheltered from the noise. The triple room we secured had a separate area for the third bed which was wonderful. Also, the breakfast was a step above the European fare found at most hotels. It included cold cuts and hard boiled eggs which was hard to find elsewhere. And breakfast was served in the ruins of a old Roman Theater from 55 BC! The Trip Advisor reviews about the front desk was the main reason why I booked the hotel. I was not disappointed! My mom was sick when we arrived and Paulo helped us find a pharmacy and make sure she had everything she needed to be comfortable. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lyssa92207
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 9 nights on our honeymoon and we couldn't have been more pleased. The hotel is clean, staff is friendly and extremely helpful, and the service is superb. The hotel is located in a wonderful area and is within easy walking distance to all the major sites in Rome. We walked everywhere - the Vatican (10 minutes), Termini (25 minutes), Colosseum (15 minutes), Borghese Gallery/Gardens (25 minutes), etc. The restaurant next door is great as are two other restaurants around the corner - Hotel Costanza and Restaurant Teatro di Pompeo. As for the room itself, we were pleasantly surprised by the size. There was plenty of room for our clothes, luggage, and other items. The bathroom was fabulous; particularly the shower. It was nicer than ours at home. All in all we had a wonderful experience and would recommend this hotel to anyone. We also used their pick-up service from the airport and it was on-time, clean, and convenient. We also used the service when leaving to go to the airport and had the same results. You will not be disappointed by Hotel Teatro di Pompeo, or Rome for that matter!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotterane
Reviews.Content: After we had read the reviews about the Hotel Teatro di Pompeo, we decided to book it; and we couldn't have been happier! This hotel is great! We had a very clean room (actually, it was the cleanest hotel we stayed at in Italy). There was also a big, private bathroom. The staff was extremely nice and helpful and spoke English fluently. The location is very good. - We walked from our hotel to all the major sights, and only took the bus to the St. Peters Cathedral. And by the way, keep an eye on our wallet when using the local buses! My boyfriend got his wallet stolen by a mother carrying a baby on her arm... Luckily, it was empty. All together, Hotel Teatro di Pompeo did truly live up to our expectations. Doubtless, we'll book this hotel the next time we go to Rome! Have a nice stay! Best wishes, Linn & TC, Norway.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for us”
Reviews.Author: ASCMMC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was difficult to find - our taxi driver even got lost a number of times but once there we couldn't have been happier. It was a 15 minute walk from the Vatican and the Colosseum but the walk is beautiful. The room was large with a king size bed and tons of room for all our luggage and our daughter's toys. The staff was very helpful, reminding us to take a hotel provided umbrella if the weather called for rain. The TV had CNN international and BBC World for the English speaking visitors. The breakfast was fruit, meat and cheese, pastries, cakes, rolls, bread, cereal and wonderful fresh made coffee and espresso. There was internet for 0.05/minute and there are so few guests you never had to wait to get online. Cannot recommend the hotel more.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Comfort, Hospitality at a great price”
Reviews.Author: travelitaly7
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days in Rome in early March. The Teatro Pompeo became our home away from home. We had a room on the third floor in the front of the building. We did hear some street noise from the wonderful restaurant right next door. This was particularly true on the weekend. The interior hallway and tenant noise was not too bad. These are the only negatives about this charming hotel in "il cuore di Roma" the heart of Rome. The location is almost unbelievable. The convenient location usually costs the traveller to Rome a small fortune. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. They would listen patiently to my feeble attempts to speak in Italian. Their advice about restaurants directions et al were spot on. The breakfast was fresh and the setting was awe inspiring. The rooms were more than adequate in size and were kept very clean. The shower curtain kept most of the water in the tub, a small miracle by Italian shower standards. A chronic issue for us shower loving Americans. As we plan a return visit to the Eternal City we would not even consider staying in another hotel!! The location is perfect, the bed was comfortable, the room was clean, the food was good and the staff was friendly. Why stay anyplace else when the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: LUVtheNW
Reviews.Content: The room was very basic, but also very clean and comfortable. It had a "bonus room" (approx. 7'x8') in between the bathroom and bedroom that was nice for staging the luggage and things. The eating area was really cool, down in a cave. There was also an Internet terminal down there for a couple euros per hour. It is just a couple blocks from Piazza Navona or Campo de Fiore (located in between the two). Pantheon is a five minute walk and the Trevi not far from there. It took us about 15 minutes to walk back from the Forum area (thru the Palazzo Venezia). For 205 euro/nt with a great breakfast, we found it very competitive for how central it was located (if you've been lookin, you'll know you pay more to be in the center of things). It is part of the sight where Julius Caesar was actually murdered (although the theater was very large back then, so it's a ways from the hotel - ask Paulo, and he'll show you on the map in the lobby :)

Reviews.Title: “Paolo is their biggest asset!”
Reviews.Author: WaldoAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Three really good reasons to stay here: Paolo, the manager, is just great...helpful, cheerful, knowlegeable, enthusiastic, knows how to deal with Americans effectively. He is sort of the unofficial mayor of the Theatro de Pompeo neighborhood. Location at/near the Compo di Fiori couldn't have been better. Easy walks to some of the best Roman sites and highlights. It is impeccably clean and a real financial bargain. We have stayed in Italy at much more expensive properties and didn't care for them as much. The breatfast here is great. If we ever go back to Rome, this is where we would stay. We recommend this Hotel to others. A downside is that when Paola isn't around you know it and feel a little abandoned. A family from Atlanta

Reviews.Title: “Could have been worse!!”
Reviews.Author: meganln
Reviews.Content: Where to start? The walls are paper thin - you can hear EVERYTHING going on in the room next door and above you. The beds barely qualified as beds they were so uncomfortable. There is no view from the windows - they look out onto the hotel's inner area (not a courtyard) or to the building next door (the guy next door doesn't close his shades before coming out of the shower. Good points - air conditioning worked well, the room was cute, breakfast was pretty good, and Lurch (guy at the front desk most of the time) was pretty friendly and helpful even if you could see him mentally roll his eyes at the "stupid Americans". Also, watch out for the ginormous key ring!

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: patrice0204
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel in June. The location is great and the rooms were clean and of a good size. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “As good as ever!”
Reviews.Author: CiaoWicklow
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in May 2006 and returned exactly one year later. It was as good as ever! The staff are extremely friendly, especially Paolo! His English is excellent and he is very helpful and friendly. The hotel is very central - just 2 minute walk (or less) to Campo di Fiori. The room we had was spacious and very clean. When the windows are closed at night you can't hear any outside noise. The shutters make the room totally dark. The breakfast is great too. The restaurant next door to the hotel, Trattoria der Pallaro is excellent - very authentic. We would highly recommend this hotel. We can't fault it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mozfather
Reviews.Content: This is a tiny little hotel in a great location within a pleasant walking distance of all the major sights. The breakfast is typical continental style, rolls, ham cheese, cake etc but it's more than enough to keep you going throughout the day. The rooms are also typical Roman style with cool tiled flooring and dark wood ceilings. Unfortunately the rooms away from the front of the building can be incredibly dark due to the nature of the buildings, (we actually had to stick our heads out of the window and crane our necks to see a reflection of the sky in the windows on the next floor to check out the weather!!), so I would highly recommend trying to bag one of the rooms at the front if you can. All in all a thumbs up for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nycrunner5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is part of an old roman theater from 55BC. The location can't be beat. You are right next to church of Sant'Andrea della Valle. This is the church that where the opening scene of Tosca takes place. You are minutes away from the Pantheon, and the Piazza Navona. The rooms were not huge but perfectly adequate, and it did have a small TV. The breakfast is ok, but for the price, and the location, you have to be pleased with the hotel. Right next to the hotel, on the right when facing the hotel, is a restaurant that offers a set meal for only 22Euros a person with wine. It was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: PierfromVenice
Reviews.Content: Nice place in the heart of Rome. I enjoyed the air conditioning - after 3 nights in a place without it. It was fun having breakfast in the 2000 years old basement of the place where Julius Caesar was murdered. Main drawback: parking my car - it is difficult w/ all the one-way narrow streets around.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for first visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: tdlitt
Reviews.Content: Our party of two couples stayed here in September. It is a stone's throw from the Campo dei Fiori and there is an excellent bargain restaurant next door ( compliments of Rick Steve's). There are also many other good restaurants in the area. The hotel was well located for our many walking tours. We stayed at the front of the building and our rooms were clean, spacious and quiet. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another good experience”
Reviews.Author: Surprised
Reviews.Content: We had our second good experience of the hotel when we revisited Rome at the beginning of November - exactly one year since our last visit. The staff were still friendly and helpful - they seemed to speak more English than they did last year (though I was actually keen to speak Italian because I'd just done an Italian course in Florence!) Our room on the 3rd floor meant there was no noise from higher floors, as there had been on our previous visit. My husband was a bit disappointed with the breakfast - packeted cereals but no muesli and minimal offerings of other things like ham (which they'd sometimes run out of even at 8.30), though one can't complain about the freshly made coffee from the coffee machine! Once again, the hotel's location was a winner for us. If you're getting a taxi to the hotel from one of the airports, remember there's now a set fare of 30 Euro from/to Ciampino and 40 Euro from/to Fiumicino - my husband arrived separately from me and got 'ripped off' with 70 Euro! Also, taxis are much cheaper than booking a hotel car which we did last time.

Reviews.Title: “Great for cuples, noisy on saturday night.”
Reviews.Author: pauline66
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 (3 couples) stayed in Feb 06. Check in was quick and efficient. The room basic but comfortable and clean. Breakfast was again basic but adequate. The best thing about this hotel was its location 90% of the major sights were within easy walking distance and some fabulous restaurants within a few minutes walk. I would stay here again and have recommended to family and friends. The only downside was the sunday night noise from neighbours!!!!!!!!!! Quietened down at 3.00am. Small bar for pre dinner drinks and nightcaps.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful annexe”
Reviews.Author: dorothytun
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at this hotel. We were with a group of friends, but my son and I were put in the annexe which I thought would be disappointing as it's across the street - but it was a lovely peaceful room overlooking the hotel and the church - other than the 2 long flights of stairs (no elevator!) , highly recommended. Staff very helpful, breakfasts amazing. Would definitely go back. Enjoyed eating with Paola (of Rick Steves fame) in her restaurant next door to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We would choose the Teatro di Pompeo again.”
Reviews.Author: zogor
Reviews.Content: But I would book earlier so we could be in the main building. Overall it was a very good experience. The location was ideal. Very clean and all of the staff friendly and helpful. I think the breakfast was probably better than most . We knew we were booked into the annex but had somehow gotten the impression it was one flight of stairs. We were in the room at the very top and that was 51 steps. The last flight was narrow and steep with a sharp corner. Since we were traveling for two weeks we had large and heavy suitcases. I suggest they either make it clear that it is not an easy flight of stairs and /or provide a porter. Once we figured out how to reprogram the air conditioner we were comfortable. We never were able to get the TV on, but we weren't in Rome to watch TV. It was just that being away from the main building it wasn't as easy to get help. That said I would choose Teatro di Pompeo again..

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sea_Brze
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed 5 nights here, between June 27 and July 2. This hotel, overall, was the nicest of the three on our vacation. The room was large, clean and quite. We stayed on the third floor, and had a view out our window of an old church dome. The only noise I ever heard from outside was seagulls cawing in the early morning. The hallways are small, and only once or twice did I hear other guests from outside our doorway. Besides the main bedroom, there was a second small room with a roll up bed. My daughter used this as her own bedroom. The bathroom was clean, large enough for the two of us, and had relatively new facilities. The room came with a mini fridge, which was handy to store food purchased and leftovers. The TV was very small, but we spent little time watching it (my daughter mainly enjoyed watching Italian MTV). The breakfasts in the grotto below the main floor were relatively large (though not full service) and more than my daughter or I usually ate. My daughter also enjoyed that the hotel had a computer in the lobby/bar area for guest use, though there was a euro per 15 minute charge. We saw many staff members during our stay, and they were generally helpful and friendly. I particularly appreciate the services of one gentleman (whose name unfortunately I do not remember) who helped us tremendously when my daughter lost her wallet (though it was never found). The hotel is centrally located in a small piazza near the Campo di Fiori. We were able to walk to most sights, but the weather was hot, and we took a few taxis during the afternoons. The way to the hotel is off small alleys, and it took us a couple of days to go to and from without getting lost and needing our map. The hotel is nothing to look at from the outside, but very nice from the inside, with tile floors and wood panneled ceilings in our room. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to any one looking for a nice reasonablly priced, centrally located hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Large Room in Annex but Beware Lots of awkward stairs to climb up”
Reviews.Author: Taiga
Reviews.Content: A really good location and we were impressed with their helpfulness. I just wish we had stayed in the main hotel. Instead they had a room for us across the little piazza in the top floor of a private building with apartments. We had one key that opened the door from the street, then we went down a long hallway and then to the left began the first set of stairs to where we popped out to the backside of the building with entrances to apartments, but it looked really like being in an alley with laundry hanging everywhere. We then had another key for the door that accesses the 4 rooms that the hotel owns. Well this is where the real awkward part begins. If you have climbed the inside of a duomo of a church you will get the picture right away. The door opens to a narrow marble staircase so if you have large luggage it will not be fun. Then you go up a bunch of stairs and there are 2 doors for rooms and then you turn and head up another flight and there is a room and then a few more stairs and down a tiny hall with a window and we were finally at our room. It was a corner room, very large with many windows, a huge bed and A/C. It was pretty quiet as well! The bathroom and closet area was large and for a romantic spot it was great. I just fear that if you had no idea like we had when the hotel told us when we were making reservations that they had a nice room in their annex for us that there would be so many stairs and no help with the bags then it would be huge issue. Not to mention the price since we were not in the main hotel that had an elevator and we had so many stairs to climb. The breakfast was good and the helpfulness of the staff was impeccable. I wished I could offer you my opinion of the hotel room in the main part but I guess I'll have to see next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to end vacation in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraMS
Reviews.Content: I picked the Hotel Teatro Di Pompeo primarily because of its location. It was my first time in Rome, the hotel seemed central to everything, and the previous reviews were very positive. I just didn't realize how very very central the hotel was!!!! It was the best place to stay for someone who had never been to Rome before - easy walking distance to all the main sites, and in the "heart" of a pretty happening area. The hotel rooms were very nice & clean - and I'm very picky! Nothing "fancy", but definitely very simple & relaxing. The hotel was very historic, and it was great to eat in the "cave" in the morning. The breakfast fare was good (for Italy), and the hotel staff were very friendly & accommodating. If I go to Rome, I am definitely going to try to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights with my wife and had no complaints whatsoever. We had a 3rd floor room that had an interior view (we could see the church dome). This was our first time in Rome so we hadn't much to compare it too but the room was clean and comfortable with the bathroom separated from the sleeping area. The staff was professional and friendly. We walked to most sites but taxied to the Vatican. Good selection of restaurants nearby and the car service to the airport (55 euros) was on time and a stress free way to leave the city. Recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Enrets
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location, close to Piazza Navona, Campo dei Fiori, and the Pantheon, and is reasonably priced in comparison with other 3-star hotels in the same area. Rooms and bathrooms are clean, spacious and well equipped (TV set, minibar, tub and shower, toiletries). The rooms' wooden ceilings are beautiful but thin so you get some noise from the people above you. Otherwise the rooms are well insulated from outside noise. Bring your earplugs if your sleep is light. The hotel should improve its breakfast, which is rather disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms But Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Hotel. I was impressed with the size of the rooms and throught the value was good for the price (we paid 135 Euro per night under a hotel special for three nights or more). However, the walls are very thin and we did not get any sleep during one of the nights since we could hear noises from the room above and next to us. It is in a good location, but if you are a light sleeper you may want to try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Czman
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Teatro Di Pompeo for three nights. Before arriving I arranged via email for their shuttle service. However, when we arrived there was no shuttle. So we took the train. The hotel concierge said I had given her the wrong arrival time. I had the original email with the correct time, but decided to let it pass. The rest of our experience was perfect. The hotel is in a great location. The room was clean, and a good size. The evening concierge was very helpful with restaurant suggestions, even making reservations for us. The breakfast was excellent, and it was a nice experience dining in the old theatre ruins. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: hiptrip
Reviews.Content: A superb location within the Cenrto Storico, especially good for short stays, as you can stumble across much by just walking around a different corner of the tiny piazza on which the hotel is sited. Efficient and calm service. Typically small rooms, but with a cared-for feel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: milica
Reviews.Content: Rome is a sprawling and chaotic city and this hotel provides the best location for exploring most of the major sites. My husband & I did plenty of research on a location and we thought this was the ideal spot to explore most of Rome by foot. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very polite gentleman who provided us with a speedy check-in, a good street map, practical information about safety (Rome is notorious for pickpockets) as well as information on restaurants and sightseeing. Our room was located on the 2nd floor just off of the main staircase/courtyard. The room and bathroom were a nice size and perfectly comfortable for our 4 night stay. The furniture is slightly outdated and the room could use a little modernization, but it was comfortable and the staff was knowledgable and friendly. They go out of there to take care of their guests, specifically when it comes to common sense safety. The bathrooms were a decent size and the shower was particularly large compared to two other hotels we stayed in during our trip to Italy. The only problem we had with the shower was the high water pressure. The water would stand at ankle length, so we adjusted the flow and that solved the problem. Just keep an eye on this as you may end up with an overflow. The hotel's ties to Roman history is evident and eating breakfast amongst the ruins or enjoying an espresso in the lobby is neat. The breakfast is substantial: coffee, pastries, cereal, cold cuts, fruit and etc...Each table is served by a pleasant waitress who brings fresh pots of coffee or tea to each table. It is a nice way to sit & enjoy a meal while planning a day of touring. It can be tricky locating it as it's tucked away, so it's a good idea to have some knowledge of the location before your arrival. We found the location on a map and showed it to our cab driver. Also, if traveling by taxi, be sure the driver turns the meter on. The hotel does provide transport to and from the airport for a fixed rate of 55 euros which we took advantage of on our departure. Be sure to book this prior to your arrival and to double check once you've checked in. The van picked us up at 6am and we were at the airport in 30 minutes. The hotel is located less than 5 minutes from Campo de'Fiori and 10-15 minutes from Piazza Navona and the Pantheon-all by foot. Piazza Navona was one of our favorite piazzas and we enjoyed the people-watching from one of the cafes. Campo de' Fiori is lively and it is interesting to visit both the market during the day as well as the active nightlife. We ate at La Carbonara one night (decent, but not exceptional food) and loved watching how the area transformed to a lively nightspot. Most of the major sites are no more than a 30 minute walk. The Colosseum, Roman Forum and Palatine Hill are less than 30 minutes. The Vatican is about 25 mintues as are the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. If you plan to spend an entire day at the Vatican it may be a good idea to take a cab there as you will be on your feet for along time. Be sure to bring a good pair of walking shoes as Rome is sprawling! The beauty of Rome is walking along those ancient cobblestone streets and coming across so much history. So much of the city is already familiar based on images we've seen throughout our lives that to actually be amongst it is exciting and worthwhile. We were able to visit everything within 3 days, but this could easily be accomplished in 2 with good planning. If you plan on traveling in the off-season (we were there in mid-November) be sure to check the hours of museums and other sites. They do reduce operating times and you will have to plan accordingly. There are a few restaurants that are worth checking out. The first would be Sergio Alla Grotto which is located just behind Campo de'Fiori. Since the weather was ideal during our entire time in Rome (it was in the 60's-70's) we enjoyed our meals outdoors. The tables are lined along the building with quaint checkered tablecloths. The place is filled with locals and is busy, but that makes all the difference in this city-if it's local, it's probably worthwhile. The food is tasty and the portions are large-we'd recommend their pasta or steak. The staff is friendly and knowledgable. Our next recommendation would be a restaurant just around the corner from the hotel called Grotto del Teatro di Pompeo. The owners are friendly and one in particular is a no nonsense woman who takes pride in her work. The meat, pasta and wine were tasty. It is a great people watching spot. Hotel Teatro di Pompeo is a nice place with reasonable rates. In our opinion it is in the perfect location for exploring the city. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, wonderful breakfast, nice rooms with many creature comforts, and accommodating staff made for a nice visit in Rome. The restaurant out left of the front door (within 50 meters) was another treat - offering a five course meal for the reasonable price of 20 Euro per person.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room, Great Shower, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: nearPhila
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Rome and the Amalfi Coast from Sept. 11 - 23. We spent our first 2 nights in Rome at Hotel Concordia (read reviews) then at Hotel Onda Verde in Praiano (read reviews) and our last three nights at Hotel Teatro di Pompeo. Obviously I used review info I found here on TripAdvisor! Although Teatro di Pompeo was a little difficult to find (our cab driver spoke no English and our Italian is limited--he dropped us off behind the hotel which wasn't obvious)--the location was convenient. I was surprised at the size of the room and bathroom. Of the three hotels, the shower here was the roomiest and had great water pressure. It seems many of the shower stalls in Italy are quite small for even average sized adults(ladies, shaving your legs can be tricky in some showers there but no problem at this hotel!) The room itself was quite large, but the mattress seemed a little old. The staff was very helpful and breakfast in the lower level (part of the original Theater of Pompeys) was sufficient and satisfying with fresh coffee, juices, cereal, meat, cheese, rolls,etc. It's very convenient to many shops and we found a supermarket nearby for wine, cheese, snacks. Of course Piazza Navonna, the Pantheon and many other "must-sees" are close by. And even if some sights are a bit farther, you end up walking around in Rome taking in as much as possible, you don't even realize the mileage you've tallied on your feet! If I have the oppportunity to return to Rome, I would certainly consider staying at Teatro di Pompeo again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: brockset
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel hidden up a small street. Quite small (30 rooms) so don't expect the trappings of a big hotel. This is where we found the first of our gripes. There's no breakfast room, so its served room service style. You order the night before but they never seemed to deliver it at the right time. The room however was excellent with everything we needed (ie a bed, you're here to see things not laze about in a room) The room we had overlooked the small street. Nice view, but unfortunately on our last night a new bar opened up. It seemed like the whole of Rome turned up for the party and they didn't leave until 5am. This might not be a problem in some of the other rooms. A couple of other gripes: the shower didn't work properly. We asked them to fix it. They didn't. We fixed it ourselves. We ran out of toilet paper. We asked them to send up more. They didn't. It got given to us as we passed the desk one night. On the whole, nice hotel, great location. We would stay there again but we're not going back to Rome anytime soon

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Fernleigh
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the good comments about it's location & we weren't disappointed. We were only a few minutes walk from the Piazza Campo de Fiori, Piazza Navona and the Pantheon and a 30 minute stroll from the Trevi Fountain. St Peters and the Termini were also within walking distance (in opposite directions). The hotel itself was pleasant. Good continental breakfast, courteous staff, clean accomodation and a good shower. The air conditioning was excellent (very quiet). The only negative points were...1) The noise outside. We looked down onto a car park but the shutters kept the noise out at night. 2) The bed was very uncomfortable. My only regret with this booking was the cost of the transport to and from the hotel which we arranged with the hotel. It was 80euros on arrival, as it was night time, and 55euros to the airport. After reading comments on Tripadvisor forum i think we paid about 20euros too much. No criticism about the drivers though and we had a stress free transfer from airport to hotel and visa versa. Overall we were very pleased with our stay and look forward to going back to Rome very soon

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Service. they make you feel at home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the point of making of our reservation with Mr. Onorati to the time we left the hotel all was very positive. We booked hotel and transportation from and to the airport. The location of this hotel is so convenient....waking distance from most of the important sites. Even the restaurant next door was a pleasant experience. Too bad they closed for vacations two days after our arrival. Each and every employee at Teatro di Pompeo Hotel was friendly. We highly recommend this small, very pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best little hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had 3 wonderful days at this GREAT LITTLE HOTEL. Great location, Great people, Great serivce. Everything new and in excellent condition. LOVELY Continental Breakfast. QUIET. Near EVERYTHING 10-15 minutes by foot or bus. We even told our travel agent about it. If we ever(we will)again visit Rome we will ONLY stay here. A Wonderful Change from giant factory-like monster hotels. They really treat you as an individual guest of the family.The Staff are real treasures. Fantasticaly Clean. Air Conditioned. Very Fair Nice Easy Rates. Simply put, AFFORDABLE QUALITY. Safe Location for Family.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location, This hotel is an a quiet street, but near to good local restaurant, many historic Roman sites. The fact that it is built on historic site is also interesting. The staff is very helpful + welcomming. They made you feel at home. WE loved staying at this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great People”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Teatro Di Pompeo is a great little hotel in the central historic area. We loved the market in the Campo Di Fiori as well as the proximity to the Piazza Navona. Our room was comfortable, clean, and air-conditioned. Very nice. Just as important, is the quality of the service we received. The service at this hotel was excellent. The people that work here are not only professional but they take the time to add that extra bit of personal care. We certainly have never had better service anywhere. We look forward to returning to Teatro di Pompeo soon.
